summary: This collection of memoranda and reports from December 1952 discusses various aspects of the National Committee for a Free Europe (NCFE), including cooperation with the CIA, evaluations of the Free University in Exile, and personnel matters.
summary_one_paragraph: This series of documents from December 1952 primarily concerns the activities and internal operations of the National Committee for a Free Europe (NCFE) and its relationship with the CIA. It includes a memorandum discussing NCFE's cooperation with the CIA in exploiting the Slansky trials, providing translations and press extracts, and conducting research. There are also evaluations of the Free University in Exile, questioning its effectiveness and student recruitment. Additionally, internal discussions about Edward W. Barrett joining NCFE as a director are documented, revealing opposition to his appointment. Finally, a domestic intelligence report extract details concerns about individuals representing the Committee for a Free Asia requesting information from universities.
title: Background Material and NCFE Cooperation
sender: Thomas W. Braden, Chief, International Organizations Division
